snippet: A reality check is in order: Carmen Fariña, the chancellor of the million-student New York City school system, is paid $212,000.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column observes that New York City Schools Chancellor Carmen Farina, in charge of million-student school system, receives an annual salary of $212,000, while chief executive of at least one charter school in New York makes more than $400,000; notes that despite such salaries, many charter schools have high teacher turnover and high rates of student suspensions.
lead_paragraph: A reality check is in order: Carmen Fariña, the chancellor of the million-student New York City school system, is paid $212,000.

headline.main: Gilded Crusade for Charters Rolls Onward
headline.print_headline: Gilded Crusade for Charters Rolls Onward
